body: **What is an Ecosystem Project Idea?** An Ecosystem Project Idea is an idea for a project that someone could build within the Optimism ecosystem. As opposed to an Ecosystem Concept or an Ecosystem Idea, an Ecosystem Project is generally more fleshed out and corresponds to a relatively clear product to be built. --- ## Summary RetroPGF Lists, being introduced in RetroPGF Round 3, are a versatile format that allows users to share their impact assessments of various projects. These lists contain a set of projects, each associated with an impact evaluation that might include, for example, a proposal of how much OP each project should receive based on their impact and profit. Additionally, each list should feature a title, a creator, and a description that outlines the methodology used for impact evaluation. A simple, user-friendly, and aesthetically pleasing interface for creating, editing, and sharing these lists is sought. See below for an example of what a list might look like, visually ## Possible Features - Try using the AttestationStation/EAS contracts to host the data behind each List. - A clean and intuitive design that allows for the effortless creation of lists, including adding project names, assigning impact evaluations, and defining evaluation methodologies. - Editing capabilities for updating or fine-tuning the lists after their initial creation. - An aesthetic presentation of lists, designed to present information clearly and effectively to viewers. - Support for various curation methods, such as single-owner lists, multi-owner lists, or perhaps even voter-based lists. ## Impact - It could simplify the process of creating and managing RetroPGF Lists, encouraging wider participation in impact evaluation. - By improving the visual presentation of these lists, the interface could aid in effectively communicating the evaluations to the broader community. - The support for various curation methods could open up new collaborative possibilities in the impact evaluation process.

title: ðŸ”´ Ecosystem Project Idea: OP Stack Deployment UI

labels.name: Ecosystem Project Idea
labels.description: Detailed project to build within the Optimism ecosystem.

body:
## Summary

The goal is to design and implement a user-friendly interface to facilitate the deployment process of an OP Stack based blockchain. The interface should allow users to efficiently configure all the required files necessary for the deployment, as well as handle the smart contract deployment. One potential source of inspiration for this project is the Arbitrum Orbit Deployment user interface. After successful deployment, the interface should provide users with the configuration files and instruct them on how to run `op-node` and `op-geth` components using these files.

## Possible Features

- A simple yet comprehensive setup process that enables users to configure all the necessary files for the deployment.
- An integrated deployment mechanism that deploys the smart contracts on behalf of the users.
- Post-deployment, the interface should provide an option to download the configuration files.
- Clear instructions and guides on how to operate `op-node` and `op-geth` with the provided configuration files.

## Impact


- It can significantly streamline the process of spinning up an OP Stack based blockchain, making it accessible to a wider range of users.
- By simplifying the configuration and deployment process, it may encourage more experimentation and development on the OP Stack.
- It can enhance the user experience by providing guidance and clarity post-deployment, contributing to a smoother onboarding process.

title: ðŸ”´ Ecosystem Project Idea: Optimism Resource Center

labels.name: Ecosystem Project Idea
labels.description: Detailed project to build within the Optimism ecosystem.

body:
**What is an Ecosystem Project Idea?**

An Ecosystem Project Idea is an idea for a project that someone could build within the Optimism ecosystem. As opposed to an Ecosystem Concept or an Ecosystem Idea, an Ecosystem Project is generally more fleshed out and corresponds to a relatively clear product to be built. 

---

## Summary

Optimism-related resources are dispersed across a range of locations such as the Community Hub, the OP Stack documentation, the Optimism Twitter account, and the Optimism Governance Forum. The fragmentation makes it challenging for individuals to find relevant information, especially data about grants as the programs are frequently updated. To mitigate this issue, we suggest developing a user-friendly website that consolidates these resources and guides users to pertinent details efficiently.

## Possible Features

- Easy navigation to guide users across available resources seamlessly.
- Detailed descriptions of crucial elements such as how to apply for specific grants, recent changes in policies, upcoming events, and more.
- A feature to help users establish connections with other projects and members of the Optimism community.
- Ensure the website is regularly updated to reflect the most recent information and developments.

## Impact

- Enhance the user experience by facilitating easier navigation through the Optimism ecosystem.
- Aid individuals and projects in securing grants, promoting good work within the community.
- Encourage more individuals to join the Optimism community by providing them with a centralized source of necessary information.

title: ðŸ”´ Ecosystem Project Idea: Community RPGF Signup Form

labels.name: Ecosystem Project Idea
labels.description: Detailed project to build within the Optimism ecosystem.

body:
**What is an Ecosystem Project Idea?**

An Ecosystem Project Idea is an idea for a project that someone could build within the Optimism ecosystem. As opposed to an Ecosystem Concept or an Ecosystem Idea, an Ecosystem Project is generally more fleshed out and corresponds to a relatively clear product to be built. 

---

## Summary

The RetroPGF grant process has changed for Round 3, now requiring teams to self-nominate. This shift could potentially leave out projects that are not aware of the process or the opportunity. To bridge this gap, we propose the creation of a public nomination form that anyone can fill out to nominate projects. The results of this form can be made available on a public read-only spreadsheet. This would allow teams to review community nominations and reach out to promising projects that might otherwise be overlooked.

Note: The RetroPGF sign-up itself is being build by the OP Labs EcoPod team and will go live in the coming months. This Project Idea's sole focus is a form for the community to suggest projects that should sign-up

**OP Labs or Optimism Foundation Contact**: Jonas (gh: @JSeiferth, TG/Discord: @jonassft)

## Possible Features

- The form should be easy to fill out and provide clear instructions to guide nominators.
- It should include specific fields designed to capture as much relevant information about the nominated project as possible.
- The results of the form submissions should be automatically populated to a public read-only spreadsheet.
- To prevent the influx of spammy entries, consider implementing basic form validation and moderation features.

## Impact

- It can help identify projects that might not be aware of RetroPGF and provide them with the opportunity to participate.
- The publicly available spreadsheet of nominations can serve as a valuable resource for teams, giving them the ability to review and reach out to nominated projects.
- This process could increase the pool of eligible projects for RetroPGF, resulting in a more diverse and inclusive grant process.

title: ðŸ”´ Ecosystem Project Idea: Simple Robust Self-Hosted RPC Proxy

labels.name: Ecosystem Project Idea
labels.description: Detailed project to build within the Optimism ecosystem.

body:
**What is an Ecosystem Project Idea?**

An Ecosystem Project Idea is an idea for a project that someone could build within the Optimism ecosystem. As opposed to an Ecosystem Concept or an Ecosystem Idea, an Ecosystem Project is generally more fleshed out and corresponds to a relatively clear product to be built. 

---


## Summary

RPCs and their respective providers can sometimes pose considerable challenges for developers due to their varied limits. In certain cases, developers might find the free tiers insufficient for their needs, leading to the necessity of purchasing premium packages. A potential solution to this issue can be the development of a high-quality RPC proxy that developers can host themselves. The key objective is to make the proxy straightforward and easy-to-configure so that it is accessible to developers at different levels of experience.

## Possible Features

- It should be easy to set up, configure, and integrate with existing systems.
- The proxy should be capable of intelligently managing and routing requests to different providers based on their rate limits and the current request load.
- It should be resilient and fault-tolerant, with the ability to failover to different providers in the event of an outage or if rate limits are exceeded.
- The proxy should provide comprehensive logging and monitoring features to help developers understand the request load, rate limit usage, and the performance of different providers.
- It should be able to work around the tier limits so that users are spending as little money as possible by taking advantage of existing free tiers.
- Maybe some sort of UI for managing the proxy.

## Impact

- It could potentially save developers considerable time, effort, and money by removing the need to manage interactions with different RPC providers and their respective limits.
- By providing a robust and fault-tolerant solution, it can increase the reliability of applications that rely on RPCs.
- The enhanced logging and monitoring can provide valuable insights into the performance and usage of different RPC providers, which can inform optimization efforts and reduce costs.
